channel.title: Sign this petition to stop the Internet Control Bill (US)
channel.description:
NEW PETITION ON WHITEHOUSE.GOV, click below! [url=https://wwws.whitehouse.gov/petitions/!/petition/amend-constitution-making-internet-unalienable-right/YJ3fXQcm]https://wwws.whitehouse.gov/petitions/!/petition/amend-constitution-making-internet-unalienable-right/YJ3fXQcm[/url] Send this to all your friends, too.
The IP Act (S.968 - PROTECT IP Act of 2011) establishes a system for taking down websites that the Justice Department determines to be "dedicated to infringing activities." The DoJ or the copyright owner would be able to commence a legal action against the alleged infringer and the DoJ would be allowed to demand that search engines, social networking sites and domain name services block access to the targeted site. In some cases, action could be taken to block sites without first allowing the alleged infringer to defend themselves in court. [b]The PROTECT IP Act would allow copyright owners – movie studios and other content providers – simply to accuse a website of infringement, which could lead to that site being shut down by court order and entire links to the site being wiped clean from the Internet. The bill is so poorly written that it would allow any copyright owner to shut down a legitimate retail website, such as Amazon or Best Buy, by alleging that one product being sold on the site could “enable or facilitate” an infringement.[/b] It could even allow any content owner to block access to the Patent Office website if it receives and posts a patent application for a product that is believed to use content without permission. The PROTECT IP Act will hurt American innovation. This bill will give one side the power to put the other side out of business and this is dangerous beyond words.

America. What are you becoming?

item.title: Sign this petition to stop the Internet Control Bill (US)
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Well, there’s now a petition on the whitehouse’s website to amend the constitution to make the Internet an unalienable right.
They only need about 20k more signatures(which may not seem much, but they only have ~5k)
https://wwws.whitehouse.gov/petitions/!/petition/amend-constitution-making-internet-unalienable-right/YJ3fXQcm

Read full topic

item.title: Sign this petition to stop the Internet Control Bill (US)
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I still dont understand.

They dont become the supreme rulers of the internet, as they need a court.

If you have copyright material located on your site, then yeah you deserve to be shut down or have it removed by a court. Maybe I should just read it.

edit:
“the DoJ would be allowed to demand that search engines, social networking sites and domain name services block access to the targeted site.”
Ok yeah that’s pretty dumb. Links are not illegal. Glad this would never happen in Canada, as the supreme court recently ruled that links cannot be illegal.

Read full topic
item.source: Sign this petition to stop the Internet Control Bill (US)

item.title: Sign this petition to stop the Internet Control Bill (US)
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:22, topic:421812”][quote author=Aftermath link=topic=524468.msg3818053#msg3818053 date=1321520410]

I shall oppose this petition out of pure spite.

The internet is a doomed mechanism in the first place, anyone who believes otherwise is being naive.

The internet is a fascist tool designed to enslave and diminish the minds of the sheeple… through mass exposure to pornography and advertising, a pleasure-centric consumerist proletariat is created, made subservient through chemical warfare in the form of oxytocin, seratonin, and prescription medication… This is 1984 all over again. Sheeple, heed the megaphone! Do not allow your minds to be enslaved… Free yourself from the artificial confines and othering culture of our society which fuels the military-industrial-sociopolitical complex.
[/quote]The internet is f(x) = x, where f(x) equals to humans, x equals to the internet. The internet is a projection of ourselves.
It has a lot of negative things, just like humans have, but, just like us, it also has a lot of positive things going on.[/quote]
From your equation it appears as if you’re saying that ‘humans’ equals ‘the Internet’. However, this is obviously false - if they were the same thing, why would we have different words for them? Therefore, by Occam’s razor, ‘humans’ does not equal ‘the Internet’. Good try though.

Read full topic
item.source: Sign this petition to stop the Internet Control Bill (US)

item.title: Sign this petition to stop the Internet Control Bill (US)
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/11/tomorrow-the-internet-starts-to-die/

A bit more in-depth on the matter.

Avaaz

Click here to urge US Congress to save the Internet!

Right now, the US Congress is debating a law that would give them the power to censor the world's Internet -- creating a blacklist that targets YouTube, Wikileaks and even Avaaz! Now if we stand with key members of the US Congress, we can defeat this...

Also many more signs on that petition.

Read full topic
